definition: exotic delicacies/luxury foodstuff from distant locations
surname Shan
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
variant of 珍[zhen1]
precious thing/treasure/culinary delicacy/rare/valuable/to value highly
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
surname Hai
taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription

sentences.english: The only feasting I do these days is in my dream.
sentences.chinese: 这几天我只能在梦中享受山珍海味了。

sentences.english: In ancient times, an emperor could have delicacies everyday.
sentences.chinese: 在古代，皇帝可以天天享用山珍海味。

sentences.english: But on the Winter Solstice, he had no appetite for the whole table of nice dishes of every kind.
sentences.chinese: 冬至节，看着满桌的山珍海味却一点儿胃口也没有了。

sentences.english: Finally, all those delicacies from mountain and sea began to nauseate me.
sentences.chinese: 那些山珍海味吃到最后，简直令人翻胃。

sentences.english: Together they enjoyed a rich feast of all the delicacies of mountain and sea.
sentences.chinese: 他们一起享用了一桌满是山珍海味的盛宴。

sentences.english: Do not eat with the wicked man or be greedy for his choice food.
sentences.chinese: 不要与虎视眈眈的人进食，也不要羡慕他的山珍海味。

sentences.english: Our restaurant serves a feast of delicacies.
sentences.chinese: 本饭店山珍海味，一应俱全。

sentences.english: Eat not with an envious man, and desire not his meats.
sentences.chinese: 不要与虎视眈眈的人进食，也不要羡慕他的山珍海味。

definition: delicacy and fine taste (idiom); a wonderful treat
delicacy/dainties/rare foodstuff
delicacy and fine taste (idiom); a wonderful treat
dishes with generous amounts of meat and fish/lavish meal
plain tea and simple food/(fig.) bread and water
fine food/delicacies/delicious food
the Manchu Han imperial feast, a legendary banquet in the Qing dynasty/(fig.) a sumptuous banquet
vegetable and meat dishes/dish
food
rare food/ambrosia (delicacy)
brocade garments, jade meals (idiom); a life of luxury/extravagance
shark fin
to smell, look and taste great
dish/lean and hungry look (resulting from vegetarian diet)/emaciated look (from malnutrition)
rich/sumptuous
food/edibles
to eat (of bird or animal)/to feed
